item.title: It Can Cost Up To $500,000 For A Spot On Opening Night Live 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/it-can-cost-up-to-500000-for-a-spot-on-opening-night-live-2025/

The cost to show your game at Opening Night Live is set to get even more expensive for studios. According to a new report from German outlet GamesWirtschaft, Geoff Keighley’s annual event at Gamescom is charging up to nearly $500,000 for an spot on Opening Night Live 2025.

The report claims that prices start at $146,800 (€140,000) for a 30-second ad and rises to roughly $487,506 (€465,000) for a 180-second (three-minute) ad, based on currency conversion rates as of writing. The three-minute ad is one of two new tiers offered for 2025 along with a 150-second ad for roughly $419,360 (€400,000). In total, there are six different tiers to choose from, all more expensive than the reported cost for the same amount of time in 2024. Across the board, the increases range from 17.4% up to 21.9%.

Opening Night Live 2025 is scheduled to air August 19, 2025, the day before Gamescom 2025 officially begins.

  • 30 seconds: $146,776 or €140,000 ($125,000 or €115,000 in 2024)
  • 60 seconds: $214,922 or €205,000 ($179,600 or €165,000 in 2024)
  • 90 seconds: $283,068 or €270,000 ($234,000 or €215,000 in 2024)
  • 120 seconds: $351,214 or €335,000 ($288,000 or €265,000 in 2024)
  • 150 seconds: $419,360 or €400,000
  • 180 seconds: $487,506 or €465,000

It’s worth noting that neither Keighley himself nor the Gamescom promoters have confirmed these prices. Insider Gaming has attempted to reach out for comment, though no response has been received as of publishing.

item.title: Complete Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl Achievements & Trophies list guide
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/complete-stalker-2-heart-of-chornobyl-achievements-trophies-list-guide/

Trophies and Achievements galore await you in Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl, and the shooter has a ton of optional objectives for you to complete from killing a certain amount of enemies to being a collecting completionist.

Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl arrives 15 years after the last iteration in the first-person shooter saga. Aside from some input lag issues and other problems, the reception for Stalker 2 has generally been quite positive.

It offers another guided tour of Chornobyl’s metaphorical house of horrors, and you are rewarded for extracurricular activities in the Chornobyl Exclusion Zone—courtesy of the extensive Stalker 2 Achievement and Trophy list.

How Many Trophies & Achievements in Stalker 2 Heart of Chornobyl?

Stalker 2 Heart of Chornobyl has 58 Achievements at launch, and the PlayStation 5 port is expected to have 59 Trophies—with the exclusive Platinum Trophy accounting for the discrepancy.

It’s not the biggest list I’ve ever seen, but it’s by no means small and is sure to keep you occupied for quite some time.

Does Stalker 2 Heart of Chornobyl Have Secret Trophies & Achievements?

Stalker 2 Heart of Chornobyl has 27 secret Achievements and Trophies to earn.

item.title: MLB The Show 25 First Details Announced
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/mlb-the-show-25-first-details-announced/

Sony San Diego has announced the first set of details for the next installment of its long-running baseball franchise, MLB The Show 25.

In a post on the game’s website, Sony San Diego gave minor teases of what fans can expect across the game while also announcing a major change coming to Diamond Dynasty in MLB The Show 25.

Starting with Diamond Dynasty, the game’s popular card-collecting mode, it has been announced that Sets and Seasons will no longer be part of the mode starting next year. The removal of Sets and Seasons means that every card will be able to be “used freely throughout the year”.

Elsewhere in the game, both Franchise Mode and Road to the Show will be getting updates in MLB The Show 25. Though not a lot was shared, the team did give a short tease of what fans should expect.

MLB The Show 25 First Details

  • Road To The Show: Deepen the player’s journey, before being drafted, and return control to how a player develops and grows in new and interesting ways.  
  • Diamond Dynasty*: Alongside the retirement of Sets and Seasons, our fans can look forward to all-new elements of the Diamond Dynasty experience blended with what our fans love most about Diamond Dynasty.  
  • Franchise: Improved trade evaluation metrics are coming along with a new fun and engaging offseason experience. 
  • Gameplay: With the expansion of quick time events, defensive AI, and pathing updates, enjoy more engaging moment-to-moment gameplay.  

MLB The Show 25 is scheduled to launch in spring 2025 and official platforms will be announced at a later date.
